question.title: Trying to include \4 (any numeric values between 0 to 9) in regular expressions in ESAPI.properties, but its throwing an error as not a valid regex
question.body:
Regex value defined in ESAPI.properties of HTTPParameterValue given below:

Validator.HTTPParameterName=^\[\\u0080-\\uFFFFa-zA-Z0-9.,;?!:%'\\\\p{L}$\\\\-"\<\>\~\\\\\[\\\\\]\`\\\\^#&()\\\\n\\\\t\\\\r\*/+=@\_}{|\\\\\\\\ \]\*$

Validator.HTTPParameterValue=^\[\\u0080-\\uFFFFa-zA-Z0-9.,;?!:%'\\\\p{L}$\\\\-"\<\>\~\\\\\[\\\\\]\`\\\\^#&()\\\\n\\\\t\\\\r\*/+=@\_}{|\\\\\\\\ \]\*$

when I try to input this value "3Y....1000.....24\0AB123456", this \\0 is consider as special character and throwing invalid input error from the given regex. But the same was working fine when I use esapi 2.2.0.0 jar. This issue is occurring in latest esapi jar from 2.4.0.0 only.

Getting below error in the console:

WARNING \[IntrusionDetector\] \[SECURITY FAILURE Anonymous:null@unknown -\> /IntrusionDetector\] Invalid input: context=HTTP parameter name: transactionId, type(HTTPParameterValue) \[input=**3Y....1000.....24AB123456**: org.owasp.esapi.errors.ValidationException: HTTP parameter name: transactionId: Invalid input. \]Please conform to regex

Tried some of regex pattern like /\\b(\[0-9\]|10)\\b /, \\d but doesn't worked. How to resolve this error.

Is there any validation has been included in latest esapi jar or any dependencies am i missing out?
